abstract.text: Registers the current user activity with the system.

inlineContent.text: The type of activity to be continued. The value is a developer-defined string in reverse-DNS format by convention, for example,
. This parameter must not be
or an empty string.
A dictionary containing app-specific state information needed to continue an activity on another device. Keys and values in the dictionary must be of the following types:
, or
A URL containing the web page to load in a browser to continue the activity. The scheme of the URL must be
or
. Any other scheme throws an exception.
Use this method to publish your app’s current activity so that it can be handled as needed. When calling this method, you must specify a value for the
parameter, the
parameter, or both. Call this method in the following situations:
In your glance interface controller, call this method and provide a
dictionary with information about what the glance displays. If the user taps your glance, that contextual information passes to your app so it can configure its interface.

Call this method to register the current activity with Handoff. The system delivers the information to the user’s iPhone, which can propagate the Handoff information to the user’s other devices. For more information about supporting Handoff, see
Call this method at any time during the execution of your interface controller’s code. The system takes the information you provide and stores it for delivery to the appropriate target.

abstract.text: An object representing a static ordered collection, for use instead of an  constant in cases that require reference semantics.
A static byte buffer that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A representation of a specific point in time, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
An object representing a static collection of key-value pairs, for use instead of a  constant in cases that require reference semantics.
A singleton object used to represent null values in collection objects that don’t allow `nil` values.
An object wrapper for primitive scalar numeric values.
An object representing a static, unordered collection of unique objects.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
Build watchOS apps that use features the app delegate monitors or controls, such as background tasks and extended runtime sessions.
A class that provides the infrastructure for managing the interface in a watchOS app.
Adds an action to the context menu by using an image provided by your WatchKit extension.
Adds an action to the context menu using a system-provided icon.
Adds an action to the context menu using an existing image resource in your Watch app bundle.
Tells the system that you are about to start a potentially lengthy update task for your glance.
Removes all programmatically added actions from the context menu.
Tells the system that you finished updating your glance content.
Responds to Handoff–related activity.
Presents a page-based interface modally.
Loads the specified interface controllers and rebuilds the app’s page-based interface.
Registers the current user activity with the system.
Registers the current user activity with the system.
Template images that you can use for menus.
Keys for retrieving text response information.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A value that identifies the location of a resource, such as an item on a remote server or the path to a local file.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type-erased hashable value.
